SEARCH
Package nsk.enhanced.System

Class MemoryService

java.lang.Object
nsk.enhanced.System.MemoryService
public class MemoryService extends Object

The MemoryService class manages a pool of threads and internal services responsible for handling plugin operations that run asynchronously, independent of the server's main thread. It ensures efficient execution of background tasks while monitoring thread and queue utilization.

This class is typically initialized during the plugin's startup in EnhancedSurveillance.onEnable(). Multiple instances of MemoryService can be created to manage different sets of tasks, with each instance having its own thread pool.

  • Field Details

    • services

      private static final List<MemoryService> services
      A static list that holds all instances of the MemoryService class. This list is used to keep track of all created MemoryService instances, allowing for operations such as load balancing, service utilization monitoring, and shutting down all services when necessary.

    • serviceCounter

      private static int serviceCounter

    • id

      private final int id

    • service

      private final ExecutorService service

    • threadPoolExecutor

      private final ThreadPoolExecutor threadPoolExecutor

    • eventCounter

      private int eventCounter

  • Constructor Details

    • MemoryService

      public MemoryService(int threads)
      Creates a new MemoryService instance with a fixed thread pool of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      threads - the number of threads in the pool

  • Method Details

    • logEvent

      public void logEvent(Runnable task)
      Submits a task for execution in this service's thread pool and logs the event. If the number of logged events reaches 20, the service's utilization is checked and logged.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to be executed

    • submit

      public void submit(Runnable task)
      Submits a task for execution in this service's thread pool without additional logging.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to be executed

    • getServiceID

      public int getServiceID()
      Returns the unique ID of this service.
      Returns:
      the service ID

    • getQueueSize

      public int getQueueSize()
      Returns the current size of the task queue.
      Returns:
      the queue size

    • getActiveThreadCount

      public int getActiveThreadCount()
      Returns the number of active threads currently executing tasks.
      Returns:
      the number of active threads

    • getThreadUtilization

      private double getThreadUtilization()
      Calculates the current thread utilization as a percentage of active threads compared to the maximum number of threads in the pool.
      Returns:
      the thread utilization percentage

    • getQueueUtilization

      private double getQueueUtilization()
      Calculates the current queue utilization as a percentage of the number of tasks in the queue compared to the total capacity of the queue.
      Returns:
      the queue utilization percentage

    • getServiceUtilization

      public void getServiceUtilization()
      Logs the current utilization of the service's threads and task queue. Provides warnings if queue utilization exceeds certain thresholds.

    • getAvailableThreads

      public static int getAvailableThreads()
      Returns the number of available threads that are not currently occupied.
      Returns:
      the number of available threads

    • execute

      public static void execute(Runnable task)
      Executes the given task using one of MemoryService services with the least loaded task queue.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to be executed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no MemoryService instances are initialized

    • logEventAsync

      public static void logEventAsync(Runnable task)
      Logs an event asynchronously using one of MemoryService services with the least loaded task queue.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to be logged
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no MemoryService instances are initialized

    • getLeastLoadedService

      private static MemoryService getLeastLoadedService()
      Selects the MemoryService service with the least loaded task queue. This method iterates over all initialized MemoryService services and returns the one with the smallest queue size.
      Returns:
      the MemoryService service with the least loaded queue, or null if no services are initialized

    • initializeServices

      public static void initializeServices(int count, int threadsPerService)
      Initializes the specified number of MemoryService services, each with a fixed number of threads. If the required number of threads exceeds the available threads, fewer services are initialized.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of MemoryService services to create
      threadsPerService - the number of threads for each service

    • shutdownAllServices

      public static void shutdownAllServices()
      Shuts down all MemoryService services. This method should is called in EnhancedSurveillance.onDisable() to ensure a graceful termination of background tasks.
